page.title: 01Newark and its western side
page.content: The arrow straight Roman{Fosseway} takes us past the bends of the navigable R.Trent and aims straight for Newark Church. The cooling towers of the power station dominate the flat agricultural landscape and act as targets for RAF bombing practices. Nearer Newark the houses sprawl along the Fosse until large housing estates are seen near the R.Devon. On entering Newark we pass historic commercial, domestic and industrial buidings, especially near the now quiescent dockland on the Trent. Hidden in the centre of Newark lies a French style market place, the bustle of activity serenely watched over by the imposing Church tower. Here we are at the crossroads of yet another historic route, the Great North Road.
